subject: Re: [junit] 'newbie' here...looking for junit.textui.TestRunner
msgSnippet: Hi Sachin, Thanks for the prompt response...I see the TestRunner class in the junit.jar...I m still a little confused but at least I know where to go to
messageBody:
Hi Sachin,
Thanks for the prompt response...I see the TestRunner class in the
junit.jar...I'm still a little confused but at least I know where to go to
resolve my confusion...
I agree, the documentation and the various online docs at www.junit.org are
excellent.
I was able to get JUnit up and running on the first try after downloading. I
wish my developers would provide such documentation...
I'm a system tester who is looking to do Component Testing, since we are headed
to EJB.
We've looked at and got running jtest and Jython (formerly known as JPython)
and now are looking at JUnit to complete our tool package. I'm working my way
thru the JUnit documentation and hope to apply it to our app before the end of
the year, at least as a 'proof of concept'.
Happy New Year,
Pat

sachin gupta wrote:

> Hello,
>
> There are no executable files (if that is what u meant). All these test
> runners are Java based classes that u can run simply by executing the
> respective classes i.e. junit.swingui.TestRunner etc.. You only need to
> include one jar file i.e. junit.jar in your classpath and maybe on you DOS
> prompt window you say
> " java junit.swingui.TestRunner " and you should see a UI. If you are
> looking for the code that is also available in respective directories.
> I think that this is among the best pieces of well documented and presented
> and useful code.
>
> Cheers,
>
> Sachin
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: lynchnco@... [mailto:lynchnco@...]
> Sent: Sunday, December 17, 2000 12:50 AM
> To: junit@egroups.com
> Subject: [junit] 'newbie' here...looking for junit.textui.TestRunner
>
> Hi,
> 'newbie' here. I'm looking for tools to test java and ejb. So far,
> I've evaluated jtest and Jython.
>
> I'm now looking at JUnit...I've downloaded and installed JUnit3.4 and
> ran the installation tests...everything went ok...
>
> I'm curious as to where the batch, graphical and Swing based
> graphical executables, namely, junit.testui.TestRunner,
> junit.ui.TestRunner and
> junit.swingui.TestRunner are.
>
> I searched the installed JUnit3.4 folder the various jar files but I
> can't find these executables...not a problem but it's driving me nuts
> that I can't find them.
>
> I'd appreciate any help.
> Thanks,
> Pat
>
